intro: Cynanchum columbianum, commonly known as Columbian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asclepiadaceae family, which includes other milkweeds, and is characterized by its milky sap. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually pink or purple in color. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological and chemical properties.
